_header: Welcome Lord in form of bread
Note:
The first two lines are similar to the prayer in the Lay Folk’s Mass Book — see Simmons (1879)
XSimmons, Thomas Frederick. The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968, 40-1.
Subjects: prayers, for use in church; Eucharist
Bibliographic Ghosts: New York, Pierpont Morgan Library G9 [olim Berkeley], Art. 3: this MS all in Latin; leaves out ME verse in this Latin text.
_description: A prayer at the ‘leuacion’ — six 6-line stanzas

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Welcom lord in forme of bredIn þe is both lyffe &
                    dedIhesu is þi nameThow Arte god in trinyte…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…Heyll fader son & holy gosteWelcom in forme off
                    brede
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 80-1; 460-2; 603.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
WElcome Lord In fourme of BredIn þe is boþe lyf and
                    ded…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Godus sone þat art so brihtIn fourme þou art of
                    bred
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 1.
EETS
         o.s. 98 (1892; repr. 1973): 2.24-5.

BLAdd37787.First Lines:
Welcome lord in forme of bredIn þe is boþe lyf and
                    ded…
BLAdd37787.Last Lines:
…ffadur and sone and holigostIn forme þou art of
                    bred
BLAdd37787.Editions:
Baugh,  Nita Scudder. 
             A Worcestershire Miscellany, compiled by John
                    Northwood, c. 1400, edited from British Museum MS. Add.
                37,787.
         Philadelphia, 1956: 149-50.

BLHar5396.First Lines: Welcom lord yn forme of bredeIn þe ys boþe lyfe & deth…
BLHar5396.Last Lines: …hayl fader & sone & holi gostWelcum lord yn forme of bred
BLHar5396.Note: Written as couplets with third and sixth lines to right; ends “Explicit.”
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: A Hymne at the Elevation of the hoste (added upper margin by a later hand, f. 273)

Lam559.First Lines:
Welcum lord in forme of bredin the is bothe lyfe and
                    dede…
Lam559.Last Lines:
…Hayle ihesu that all thing wosthayle fadyr and son and the
                    holi gostwelcome in form of bred

PierpontG9.Note: NB: not found in this MS.
